text: does grilling a whole fish make you a
little squeamish well it's time to get
over it because grilling a whole fish is
just as easy as grilling fillets but it
tastes so much better when you're
grilling whole fish I find it easier if
you use smaller ones about one to one
and a half pounds per fish per person
you want to have your fishmonger scale
it gut it it should be nice and clean
and then you want to season it inside
and outside now I've got blood all over
my hand if you like grilled fish
definitely invest in a fish basket it
just makes it so much better however if
you don't have one you can just go ahead
and grill your fish directly on the
grill great and if the skin rips don't
stress it'll still taste delicious not
nice you want really hot coals or a
really high flame when you're grilling
fish because that's what's gonna give
you those caramelized crispy edges so
put the fish directly in the center of
the grill and it's gonna cook in about
two to three minutes per side so what
you're looking for you want yeah
beautiful you want it to be golden and
kind of blistery on one side and then
you flip it over and you get that same
beauty on the other side
ah New York City don't you just love
grilling in New York City if you like
you can fillet the fish before you serve
it to your guests or what I like to do
is give everybody their own fish and let
them have at it it's actually a lot more
fun to eat it that way when you grill
whole fish the skin takes on a real char
just has an incredible smoky flavor so I
like to pair it with flavors that can
stand up to that for the sauce I chose
Thai flavors lemongrass coconut milk for
sweetness shallot Thai chili and lots of
cilantro and lime there are so many
great reasons to grill whole fish but my
personal favorite I get to eat the cheek
you know you can eat the eyeball too
it's actually really good little crunchy
